src:
Tingkat Hunian Kamar Hotel di September Menurun
01 Nov 2019, 17:45 by Johanes Randy Prakoso, Danang Sugianto


Ilustrasi hotel (Thinkstock)

Jakarta - Pihak Badan Pusat Statistik baru saja mengeluarkan data terbaru terkait industri Pariwisata bulan September. Diketahui, tingkat hunian kamar hotel menurun.Dilihat detikcom dari data BPS terbaru, Jumat (1/11/2019), tingkat Penghunian Kamar (TPK) hotel klasifikasi bintang di Indonesia pada September 2019 mencapai rata-rata 53,52 persen atau turun 5,43 poin dibandingkan dengan TPK September 2018 yang tercatat sebesar 58,95 persen. Begitu pula jika dibanding TPK Agustus 2019, TPK hotel klasifikasi bintang pada September 2019 mengalami penurunan sebesar 0,62 poin.Rata-rata lama menginap tamu asing dan Indonesia pada hotel klasifikasi bintang selama September 2019 tercatat sebesar 1,84 hari, terjadi penurunan sebesar 0,13 poin jika dibandingkan keadaan September 2018.Diketahui, fakta tersebut berbanding lurus dengan turunnya jumlah kunjungan wisatawan mancanegara (wisman) bulan September ini dibanding Agustus kemarin. Kepala BPS Suhariyanto mengatakan, jumlah kedatangan turis asing di September 2019 turun sebesar 10,10% dari bulan sebelumnya."Jumlah wisman 1,4 juta ini memang menurun dibandingkan posisi Agustus karena peak season. Jadi turun 10,10%," ujarnya di Gedung BPS Jakarta, Jumat. Simak Video "Melihat Eloknya Jakarta dari Lensa Kamera"[Gambas:Video 20detik](rdy/rdy)
text:
Hotel Room Occupancy Rate in September Decreased
01 Nov 2019, 17:45 by Johanes Randy Prakoso, Danang Sugianto


Illustration of hotel (Thinkstock)

Jakarta - The Central Statistics Agency has just released the latest data related to the Tourism industry in September. It is known, the occupancy rate of hotel rooms is decreasing. As seen from the latest BPS data, Friday (11/01/2019), the occupancy rate of star hotels in Indonesia in September 2019 reached an average of 53.52 percent or down 5, 43 points compared to the September 2016 TPK of 58.95 percent. Likewise, if compared to the ROR for August 2019, the ROR for star classification hotels in September 2019 decreased by 0.62 points. The average length of stay of foreign and Indonesian guests in star classification hotels during September 2019 was recorded at 1.84 days, a decrease of 0 , 13 points when compared to the situation in September 2018. It is known, this fact is directly proportional to the decline in the number of foreign tourist arrivals (tourists) this September compared to last August. BPS head Suhariyanto said, the number of foreign tourist arrivals in September 2019 fell by 10.10% from the previous month. "The number of 1.4 million foreign tourists is decreasing compared to the position of August due to peak season. So down 10.10%," he said at the Building Jakarta BPS, Friday. Check out the video "Seeing the Beauty of Jakarta from the Camera Lens" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (rdy / rdy)
